Upload Screenshot Hari Babu K Pilani Computer Science Associate Professor, Department of Computer Science & Information Systems, BITS Pilani, Pilani Campus Location management and maintenance in P2P overlay networks, Resilience in P2P networks, Security issues in P2P overlay networks Room No: 6121-M, New Academic Building, Department of Computer Science & Information Systems, Birla Institute of Technology & Science, Pilani- 333031, Rajasthan. India. khari@pilani.bits-pilani.ac.in Phone:+91-1596-255405 (Off) | 255813 (Desk) Fax:+91-1596-244183 About Prof. Haribabu Kotakula received his PhD degree in Computer Science from Birla Institute of Technology & Science, Pilani, Rajasthan, India in 2013. He is currently working as Associate Professor at BITS Pilani. His research interests include Software Defined Networking, Programmable Networks, IoT, Edge and Cloud computing. He teaches courses such as Cloud Computing, Parallel Computing, Network programming, Database Systems, Computer Programming, Objet-oriented Programming etc. He has actively participated in institutional development activities at BITS Pilani, Pilani campus by leading several projects to modernize and automate its several academic activities. He leads the Software Defined Networking (SDN) Laboratory of the Department of CSIS, BITS Pilani, Pilani Campus.
